reviewText: I'm biased, lets get that out of the way. I'm a big Killswitch fan. I've seen them multiple times live and have numerous albums etc of theirs.If you have been fortunate enough to see this band live then you know what a great show they put on - metal fan or not if you get the chance you should go see them.This DVD really captures the energy and quality of a live KsE performance. The sound quality it top notch and sounds THUNDEROUS on a home theater. Adjust your levels with the bass slightly heavier than your mid range for the absolute best expierience.There is also a section of KsE music vids on the disc which is great! The only downside to any of the videos is the one for "End of Heartache." The audio is the version from the second Resident Evil movie which is lackluster when compared to the album version - literally my sole complaint.An interesting documentary rounds out the disc as well giving some history of the band. For any metal fan this is an easy purchase, there will not be any dissapointment. Melodic metal at it's finest.
summary: Some of the best metal in a sea of garbage!

reviewText: I own a lot of dvd concerts, but this is the one I keep watching over and over again. I do wish it had dolby digital audio. But that said, playing it in my ps3 it sounds good and looks great!!! This is a must buy!!

reviewText: This is hands down the best metal/hardcore music dvd ever!  If you've ever seen killswitch live you know they never dissapoint.  If you haven't seen killswitch this is the perfect product to introduce you to them.  The sound quality is excellent, as is the video coverage.  Killswitch is the bbest band in the scene today, possibly ever.  In this dvd they play almost every song from the first two major releases.  Do yourself a favor and buy this dvd.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The concert is well recorded and well filmed.  You can see how skilled they are as musicians - the guitars aren't just brutal, but they are intricate and interweaving.  Howard is just an amazing vocalist with huge stage presence.  The documentary is a huge bonus, not just talking about the development of the band, but also demonstrating their camaraderie and solidarity with other similar bands (many of which you may find yourself wanting to hear).  A must for metalcore fans.
summary: Excellent overview of what KsE does

reviewText: Great performance... there may be some overdubs... which is pretty normal for most live productions.  Audio format is only 2-channel.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I remember back in May of 2005, Adam D. mentioned that there was no plans for a dvd. But I guess sooner or later like most bands, they figured they had to do it. Not that there's anything wrong with that. Words can't even describe how great KSE's dvd is. All of the music videos are included (big plus), and an incredible in-depth documentary on the band with so many different artists (Unearth, God Forbid, Lamb Of God, Shadows Fall, Soilwork, and In Flames to name a few) and their takes on the band, as well as some words from former frontman Jesse David Leech. The setlist for the show was perfect, nothing but the best songs they've ever done...and did I read some people mentioning "overdubs?" Who cares if the sound is too perfect? Enjoy it for what it is, this may as well be the best show KSE has ever done.Other honerable dvd mentions:Machine Head - ElegiesCradle Of Filth - Peace Through Superior FirepowerSoulfly - The Song Remains InsaneAnthrax - Alive 2 (2005)Lamb Of God - KilladelphiaShadows Fall - The Art Of Touring (awesome if you're a strong fan of SF and enjoy bootleg-like footage, otherwise stay away)
summary: This is an example of how a band should do a dvd
Title: N/A

reviewText: KsE is my #1 favorite band(although they departed with old singer Jesse Leech shortly after getting into them....which is explained also in the dvd by the way)This disc has great footage and lots of it.behind the scenes a documentary and all the videos..even one I havent seen!My only gripe with the disc is this..Its widescreen which is great..BUT the sound is only in digital stereo NOT 5.1,like so many others are..oh well,I guess.Everything else is perfect though,camera angles and all.I've seen them 4 times so far live and this disc sums it all up for anyone who hasnt had the pleasure of seeing them...amazing!BUY THIS DISC!

reviewText: This is Killswitch Engaged's first ever dvd. Is it good? NO! It's great! It has all the bands videos, a full concert of over an hr of songs they play live as you all know. And there Bio of how the formd and became a band. This dvd is really great, gives you a lot of info you might not know and or already know, but it is still a very good cd. Even has Corey from SlipKnoT in it. Which I must say is quite cool. A lot of funny stuff on that dvd too. If you are a KsE fan or just love roadrunner records pick this dvd up!
Title: N/A

reviewText: After seeing what Lamb of God did with their Killadelphia DVD, I was thinking that since they pretty much set the bar for excellence in video and audio quality for a concert DVD, I may be disappointed, not so!  Aside from not giving us a 5.1 mix, the audio was dynamic and sounded superb, although nowhere near as "raw" sounding as a live performance probably due to some studio "touch ups".  Either way you get an awesome sounding stage spectacle and a fun look inside the band from several interviews with the members as well as perspectives from other bands in the genre.  This DVD was fun, entertaining, and as a fan of hard rock and all it's sub genres, pure eye and ear candy!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: UPDATE ADDED FEB 23rd 2006:Whoa clearly I offended some KsE fans with my review... So in my defense I will set the record straight. [I just watched the concert again last weekend.]1) There is Overdubs..... And they aren't used that sparingly .  [Also I did NOT claim they played with audio I simply stated they `dressed' up the `live' sound in the Studio.]2) We are not here to review their live performance at their actual shows... we are here to review the Product in question. (Which is a DVD)  I have no doubt they would put on a good live show... I can see it for a fact... they are energetic with a good stage presence.  But this doesn't change that the DVD was OVERDUBBED!3) This is a review column and I am entitled to my opinion whether it be, 1,2,3,4 or 5 stars as long as you give a reason to back your rating...  I clearly explained why I gave it 2.5 (Which I always round down, see my other reviews for proof of half-stars...) - It's not like I said it sucks and gave it one star.Below is my original review posted Feb 6th 2006.________________________________________KILLSWITCH ENGAGE - Set This World Ablaze.-Some of my close friends are big fans of KsE so when they got the DVD - It came over to my house...Personally I never really got into their Powerful Boy-Band Choruses but also had tons of respect for Adam D. and the bands general musicianship.  Now that being said I did watch the concert...Is it enjoyable?  Yes.  Is it over-dubbed?  Hell Yes.I mean as cool as it is to be in a cape and running around on stage in your boxers...  If you need to overdub the music is it really worth the show?I just feel they've crossed the line from artists to entertainers.  Puppets of the `New Wave of American Metal' Scene... Also I'm really not trying to be rude but the reason everyone says:"This is the best Live DVD I've ever seen!!!"Are saying this because it isn't really `LIVE' - They used Overdubs!!!  Sometimes minimal overdubs are done live to fix a minor error... (Pantera's Live CD contained minimal overdubs if any.... Also Opeths Live DVD - LAMENATIONS contained ZERO overdubs.)  But they shouldn't be produced to the point of a studio album... (Must be nice to have Roadrunner Records funding full-scale studio production of a Live Recording...)Also just because I'm being picky, Howard Jones has a really weak 'Live' voice.... There I said it. I'm sorry but it's true.Overall I would recommend it for fans of KsE... It is, at least entertaining... and bonus footage is decent.The best I could give it was-2.5 Stars[Kids, as much as I have respect for Adam D. there are much better bands then KsE.  For similar, but better, NWoAHM bands check out: Unearth, Lamb of God, All that Remains, Trivium or even God Forbid's Newest album. For some more unique bands that blend Metal with actual singing try: Opeth, Between the Buried and Me,or Into Eternity.]IF YOU LIKED, AGREED, OR APPRECIATED THIS PLEASE CLICK YES FOR:"Was this review helpful?"
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was supposed to go to this show. The live set displayed on this DVD. It was at the Wocester Palladium a while back. My brother and his friends went though and can be seen up front in center in the crowd during this DVD.I get a little jealous, because the show rips it all up. Not that I haven't seen these guys before. I've damaged myself a handful of times at Killswitch shows. I even broke a pair of glasses one time in the pit. YEEEEAAAAAAHHHH!!! This DVD shows what makes these guys rock, and is definately a great time.Not only do you get the live show, but also you get all of their music videos (even the old underground stuff), and a very informative DVD. Oooh yeah. So what are you waiting for, get this thing, and go out and kill!
Title: N/A
